☰

For these exercises, it will be helpful to review the notes on Linear Classifiers

1) Feature representation

For the following feature, pick what might be the best encoding for linear classification. The assumption is that there are other features in the data set.

The point of this question is to think about alternatives; there are many options, many not mentioned here.

Car make, e.g. Chevy, Ford, Toyota, VW, for predicting gas mileage (lo, hi).
100.00%
You have infinitely many submissions remaining.

2) Feature mapping

Consider the following, one-dimensional, data set. It is not linearly separable in its original form.

  1. x(1)=−1,&ThinSpace;y(1)=+1x^{(1)} = −1, \, y^{(1)} = +1x(1)=−1,y(1)=+1
  2. x(2)=0,&ThinSpace;y(2)=−1x^{(2)} = 0, \, y^{(2)} = −1x(2)=0,y(2)=−1
  3. x(3)=1,&ThinSpace;y(3)=+1x^{(3)} = 1, \, y^{(3)} = +1x(3)=1,y(3)=+1

Ex2.a.: Which of these feature transformations leads to a separable problem?

  1. ϕ(x)=0.5∗x\phi(x) = 0.5*xϕ(x)=0.5∗x
  2. ϕ(x)=∣x∣\phi(x) = |x|ϕ(x)=∣x∣
  3. ϕ(x)=x3\phi(x) = x^3ϕ(x)=x3
  4. ϕ(x)=x4\phi(x) = x^4ϕ(x)=x4
  5. ϕ(x)=x2k\phi(x) = x^{2k}ϕ(x)=x2k for any positive integer kkk

Enter a Python list with a subset of the numbers 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
100.00%
You have infinitely many submissions remaining.

Ex2.b.: Your friend Kernelius uses feature transformation ϕ(x)=(x,x2)\phi(x) = (x, x^2)ϕ(x)=(x,x2) on the data above. In the new space, the linear classifier with θ=(0,1)\theta=(0,1)θ=(0,1) and θ0=−0.25\theta_0=-0.25θ0​=−0.25 achieves perfect accuracy. What points from the original space R\mathbb{R}R map to this linear classifier in R2\mathbb{R}^2R2? (It may be helpful to find the equation of the separator.)

Enter a Python list with all values of xxx which constitute this separator.
0.00%
You have infinitely many submissions remaining.

Solution: [-0.5, 0.5]

Explanation:

With θ=(0,1)\theta = (0,1)θ=(0,1) and θ0=−0.25\theta_0 = -0.25θ0​=−0.25, our separator is the line y=0.25y=0.25y=0.25 in R2\mathbb{R}^2R2. From our original space R\mathbb{R}R, points mapped onto the separator are those for which x2=0.25x^2=0.25x2=0.25, leading to x=±0.5x=\pm 0.5x=±0.5
